metadata.title: Women and Labour in Late Colonial India: The Bengal Jute Industry

relevance.topic: Labor displacement due to technological change in the Bengal Jute Industry
relevance.relevance: The study is relevant as it examines the displacement of women workers in the Bengal jute industry due to technological changes and social factors, highlighting the gendered impact of industrialization.

design.sample_characteristics: Focus on women workers in the Bengal jute industry, primarily widows and deserted wives, during the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

dependent_variables.displaced: Women workers declined from 25% to 2% of the workforce.
dependent_variables.unemployment_or_underemployment: Women were marginalized in the industry, often replaced by men.
dependent_variables.wage_changes: Women were paid less than men, and their work was considered unskilled.

key_themes: Social and economic marginalization of women
text_fragments: Women workers in the jute industry declined from 25% to 2% of the workforce.
The industry increasingly employed men, marginalizing women.
qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes how technological changes and social constructions of gender led to the marginalization and displacement of women workers in the Bengal jute industry.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Period of industrial expansion and competition in the jute industry.
historical_context.institutional_context: Colonial labor policies and social norms influenced employment practices, with a focus on male labor.

outcomes.main_findings: The study finds that technological changes and social norms led to the displacement and marginalization of women workers in the Bengal jute industry.
outcomes.conclusions: Technological advancements and gender biases in labor practices contributed to the decline of women workers in the jute industry.
outcomes.long_term_impacts: The displacement of women workers had long-term effects on their economic independence and social status.

quality_assessment.methodological_limitations: The study relies on historical records and qualitative analysis, which may not capture all quantitative aspects of labor displacement.
quality_assessment.coherence: The study provides a coherent narrative linking technological changes to gendered labor displacement.
quality_assessment.adequacy_of_data: The study uses a rich set of historical data to substantiate its conclusions.
quality_assessment.relevance: The study is highly relevant to understanding the gendered impact of technological change in industrial settings.
